title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel that explores the consequences of a technologically advanced and socially controlled society.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A tale of the intense and destructive love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy adventure that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he aids in a quest to reclaim a lost kingdom.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that portrays the tragic love affair between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational story that follows the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novel that follows the Joad family as they travel to California during the Great Depression.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
description: A novel that explores the life of a doctor's wife who has adulterous affairs and lives beyond her means.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A story of the adventures of a man who believes he is a knight and his loyal squire, Sancho Panza.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An epic poem that describes Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A novel that explores the lives of several characters, particularly the ex-convict Jean Valjean, in post-revolutionary France.

title: The Iliad
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that tells the story of the last weeks of the Trojan War.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel that follows the life of an orphan named Pip as he grows up and learns about life and society.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel that tells the story of a man whose portrait ages while he remains young and beautiful.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A novel that tells the story of Edmond Dantès's betrayal, imprisonment, and revenge.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel that tells the story of Victor Frankenstein and his creation, a creature known as the Monster.

title: The Stranger
author: Albert Camus
description: A novel that explores the absurdity of human existence through the eyes of its protagonist, Meursault.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel that tells the story of the French Revolution through the lives of several characters.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A novel that tells the story of Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel that tells the story of Huck Finn and his journey down the Mississippi River.

title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Arthur Conan Doyle
description: A collection of short stories that follow the adventures of the detective Sherlock Holmes and his friend Dr. Watson.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel that explores a future where books are banned and 'firemen' burn them.

title: Lolita
author: Vladimir Nabokov
description: A novel that tells the story of a middle-aged man who becomes obsessed with a 12-year-old girl.

title: The Metamorphosis
author: Franz Kafka
description: A novella that tells the story of a man who wakes up one morning to find himself transformed into a giant insect.

title: Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A novel that follows the experiences of a bombardier in World War II and explores the absurdities of war.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A novel that tells the story of a runaway slave and her struggle to confront her past.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A narrative of the adventures of Captain Ahab in pursuit of Moby Dick, a great white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia and its impact on Tsarist society.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that follows the journey of Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

title: Ulysses
author: James Joyce
description: A modernist novel that chronicles the experiences of Leopold Bloom in Dublin on June 16, 1904.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel that explores the moral struggles of the Karamazov family.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A psychological drama that delves into the mind of a young murderer.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel that follows the experiences of the eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and love for Mr. Rochester.

author: Margaret Mitchell

author: J.D. Salinger

title: Slaughterhouse-Five
author: Kurt Vonnegut
description: A novel that blends elements of science fiction with a semi-autobiographical account of the bombing of Dresden in World War II.

author: William Faulkner
description: A novel that explores the decline of the Compson family through the perspectives of its members.

title: Of Mice and Men
author: John Steinbeck
description: A novella that tells the story of two displaced ranch workers during the Great Depression.

title: The Old Man and the Sea
author: Ernest Hemingway
description: A novel that tells the story of an aging Cuban fisherman who struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.

author: John Steinbeck
